summary: Melvin Kreidman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily relate to his employment records, including payroll authorizations, leave records, and internal memoranda. He appears in payroll certifications for May 1978 and November 1977. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board in 1995 concerns his HSCA staff payroll records, with his Social Security number postponed from release due to privacy concerns.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Melvin Kreidman's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, which investigated the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his payroll records are considered relevant to the historical record of the investigation.
